title: ‘We’ll see how it plays out’: Caleb Durbin, Marcelo Mayer each to practice at 2B, 3B to begin spring training
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Caleb Durbin and Marcelo Mayer to practice at second and third base during Red Sox spring training.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora seeks to solidify infield positions amid ongoing roster evaluation.
Boston focuses on reducing errors, with 116 committed in 2025, the most in MLB.

title: Report: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant to stay in New England, won’t take OC interviews
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots quarterbacks coach Ashton Grant will not pursue offensive coordinator positions, remaining with New England for the 2026-27 season.
Grant played a key role in quarterback Drake Maye's development, contributing to Maye's near-MVP season and leading the league in completion rate.
New England's coaching lineup, including Mike Vrabel and Josh McDaniels, will provide continuity for Maye's third NFL season.

title: Brighton community raises $25k for flooded barbershop
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: The Brighton community raised over $25,800 for Matt's Barber Shop after a burst pipe caused significant flooding.
Customer Dietrich Warner initiated a GoFundMe campaign to support Matt's Barber Shop, contributing to a community-driven recovery effort.
Matt Charette, owner of the affected barbershop, expressed gratitude for the neighborhood's support as cleanup and repairs commenced.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Eternity,' starring Elizabeth Olsen, is streaming on Apple TV as a romcom featuring a fantastical afterlife premise.
'Dawson's Creek,' starring the late James Van Der Beek, is available on Netflix, Hulu, and Tubi.
'Love Is Blind' Season 10, a hit reality show challenging blind dating norms, is now streaming on Netflix.

title: Court says Mass. father’s battle over LGBTQ-friendly lessons excludes books on gender stereotypes
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Federal judge rules Lexington father's lawsuit doesn't cover books on gender stereotypes like 'Pink Is For Boys'.
Alan L.'s lawsuit challenges LGBTQ-friendly materials in son's classroom, citing conflict with Christian values.
Court notes Alan L. likely has the right to direct his child's educational and religious upbringing, but case is pending.

title: Roman Anthony set to join Team USA for World Baseball Classic if he passes physical
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony, 21, set to join Team USA for World Baseball Classic, pending physical, replacing injured Corbin Carroll.
Anthony would be the youngest player on Team USA, adding depth to an outfield already featuring Aaron Judge and Byron Buxton.
Garrett Whitlock joins Anthony as the only other Red Sox player on Team USA; World Baseball Classic starts March 5.

title: $20M penthouse at Taylor Swift’s rumored wedding venue hits market
author: Regina Cole
bullets: $20 million Ocean House penthouse in Westerly, Rhode Island, is on sale, offering luxury amenities and ocean views.
The 4,696-square-foot unit combines two condominiums, featuring three bedrooms, four bathrooms, and multiple living spaces.
Owning the penthouse grants access to Ocean House Club amenities, including a spa, gym, private beach, and dining options.

title: 10 Celtics stats that should show encouragement and discouragement entering All-Star break
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Celtics are ranked third in offensive rating and second in defensive rating entering the All-Star break.
Jaylen Brown scores 29.3 points per game, leading Boston to second place in the Eastern Conference at 35-19.
Despite strong scoring, the Celtics struggle in clutch games, ranking 21st in the league with a 12-14 record.

title: Your Cape Cod winter guide: 20 things to do during the cold months
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Cape Cod offers winter activities including museums, beaches, and trails, maintaining its allure year-round, according to local experts.
Visitors can explore museums like the Sandwich Glass Museum and enjoy outdoor activities, such as snowshoeing at Nickerson State Park.
Dining options on Cape Cod range from Far Land Provisions in Provincetown to the unique self-pour UVA Wine Bar in Mashpee.

title: She’s running Boston for people like her with Type 1 Diabetes
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Kristine 'Krissy' Lapczynski is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to benefit Breakthrough T1D, supporting Type 1 Diabetes research.
Lapczynski, based in Fuquay-Varina, NC, lived in Boston during her pharmacy studies at MCPHS University from 2012 to 2018.
She was hospitalized with diabetic ketoacidosis while in college and has managed Type 1 Diabetes for 23 years.
